curam.util.resources
Interface EnvironmentConstants.KeyServer

Enclosing interface:
EnvironmentConstants
public static interface EnvironmentConstants.KeyServer

These settings allow a customer to configure the behavior of the KeyServer.

Field Summary
static java.lang.String kDefaultUniqueIdSet
          The name of the default key set used by the application.
static java.lang.String kKeyServerCacheSize
          Default: 1 : Specifies the number of unique ID keysets to be consumed and cached per Key Server transaction.
static java.lang.String kKeyServerCuramSupport
          Default: false.
static java.lang.String kKeyServerNotification
          Default: 100000000.
static java.lang.String kKeyServerRetryCount
          Default: 5.
 

Field Detail

kDefaultUniqueIdSet

static final java.lang.String kDefaultUniqueIdSet
The name of the default key set used by the application. Property name : curam.keyserver.default.unique.set

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kKeyServerRetryCount

static final java.lang.String kKeyServerRetryCount
Default: 5. The number of retries that will be performed if there is a problem communicating with the key server before that problem is reported to the user. Property name : curam.keyserver.retry

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kKeyServerCuramSupport

static final java.lang.String kKeyServerCuramSupport
Default: false. The range aware key server algorithm allows usage of group from 3 to 32,768. But as group 2 is to allocated for Cúram support.This property can be set to true to state keys generated are for Cúram support purpose. Property name : curam.keyserver.support

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kKeyServerNotification

static final java.lang.String kKeyServerNotification
Default: 100000000. The range aware key server algorithm supply a notification to administrators when a particular key set is nearing the end of the systems allocated range.This notification would be sent repeatedly at defined magnitude intervals before exhaustion e.g. the first message sent when there are X key blocks remaining for the key set, the next when there are X/10 key blocks remaining etc. Range Aware Key Server send these notifications only in case if there are no further ranges allocated to the system. Property name : curam.keyserver.remaining.keyblock.notification

See Also:
Constant Field Values

kKeyServerCacheSize

static final java.lang.String kKeyServerCacheSize
Default: 1 : Specifies the number of unique ID keysets to be consumed and cached per Key Server transaction. Property name : curam.keyserver.keyset.cachesize

See Also:
Constant Field Values
